alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued December 31 at 3:57PM ChST until January 01 at 6:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON ALONG EAST FACING REEFS... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents. Indo-Pacific Man-o-War. * WHERE...Along east facing reefs for the High Rip Current Risks. For the Beach Hazard Statement, all beaches and surf zones. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, through Sunday afternoon. For the High Rip Current Risk, through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. Contact with Indo-Pacific Man-o- War, alive or dead, can cause extreme pain and may be fatal in some cases. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A high rip current risk will be along east facing reefs of the Marianas through Wednesday afternoon. Beach Hazard Statement for Man-o-War out through Sunday. Man-o-War have been reported washed up on north facing beaches on Guam. Man-o-War may still be found on beaches and the waters of the Marianas.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help. Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
